Title: Social sustainability tensions in multi-tier supply chain: A systematic literature review towards conceptual framework development
Authors: K. Govindan, Mahesh Shaw, A. Majumdar
Abstract summary: This paper reviews the literature on social sustainability in multi-tier supply chains, identifying drivers, issues, barriers, tensions, practices, and performance, but does not specifically address software services.

Title: A framework of sustainability drivers and externalities for industry 4.0 technologies using the Best-Worst Method
Authors: Jamal El Baz, S. Tiwari, Temidayo O. Akenroye, A. Cherrafi, Ridha Derrouiche
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a framework for assessing the readiness of organizations to adopt sustainability-oriented Industry 4.0 initiatives.

Title: Sustainability accounting and reporting in the industry 4.0
Authors: Kamlesh Tiwari, Mohammad Shadab Khan
Abstract summary: The paper explores the challenges and drivers of sustainability accounting and reporting in the context of Industry 4.0 technologies.

Title: Exploring the sustainability performances of firms using environmental, social, and governance scores
Authors: R. Rajesh
Abstract summary: The paper analyzes ESG scores to identify the most important indicators contributing to sustainability performance of Indian firms, with implications for improving governance.

Title: Micro, small, and medium suppliers' perspectives on supply chain social sustainability: New evidence from India
Authors: Neha Uttam, Pankaj Dutta, Ashish Singh
Abstract summary: This paper is not directly relevant to the query about social sustainability reporting readiness in software services. It examines socially sustainable practices and their drivers and barriers among micro, small, and medium suppliers in India's manufacturing sector.

Title: Uptake of sustainability reporting adoption by non-governmental organisations: An agenda for policy and practice
Authors: I. E. Asogwa
Abstract summary: This paper is not directly relevant to the query about social sustainability reporting readiness in software services, as it focuses on sustainability reporting adoption by non-governmental organizations.

Title: Sustainable development goal reporting: Contrasting effects of institutional and organisational factors
Authors: N. Subramaniam, S. Akbar, H. Situ, Sophia Ji, N. Parikh
Abstract summary: Sustainable Development Goal reporting by companies is driven by external institutional factors and organizational characteristics.

Title: Corporate sustainability reporting
Authors: Richard Barker
Venue: Journal of Accounting and Public Policy
Abstract summary: This paper provides a general overview of corporate sustainability reporting, but does not specifically address challenges or drivers in the software services industry.

Title: Modeling the pressures for sustainability adoption in the Indian automotive context
Authors: Deepak Mathivathanan, V. Agarwal, K. Mathiyazhagan, Tarik Saikouk, Andrea Appolloni
Abstract summary: This paper is not directly relevant to the query about social sustainability reporting readiness in software services. It examines the pressures for adoption of sustainable supply chain management practices in the Indian automotive industry.

Title: Corporate social responsibility in emerging markets: Opportunities and challenges for sustainability integration
Authors: L. Cezarino, L. Liboni, T. Hunter, L. Pacheco, F. Martins
Abstract summary: Corporate social responsibility practices in emerging markets can drive social inclusion and welfare, supporting achievement of the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

Title: Recent Developments in Sustainability Reporting
Authors: B. Edge
Abstract summary: This paper discusses recent developments in sustainability reporting, but does not specifically address challenges or drivers in the software services industry.

Title: Organisational sustainability readiness: A model and assessment tool for manufacturing companies
Authors: Ilaria Barletta, M. Déspeisse, Steven Hoffenson, B. Johansson
Abstract summary: This paper proposes a model and assessment tool to help manufacturing companies build capabilities for sustainable operations.

Title: Data‐driven insights for circular and sustainable food supply chains: An empirical exploration of big data and predictive analytics in enhancing social sustainability performance
Authors: Surajit Bag, Gautam Srivastava, A. Cherrafi, Ahad Ali, R. Singh
Abstract summary: Big data and predictive analytics can increase information sharing and stakeholder connectivity, enhancing social sustainability in circular food supply chains.

Title: Business sustainability reporting and assurance and sustainable development goals
Authors: Z. Rezaee, Saeid Homayoun, Nick J. Rezaee, Ehsan Poursoleyman
Abstract summary: Socially responsible firms adopting sustainable development goals are more likely to issue sustainability reports and obtain assurance statements.

Title: Modelling the importance of social responsibility standards (ISO 26000:2010) practices adoption in freight transport industry
Authors: Aalok Kumar
Abstract summary: The paper analyzes the importance of ISO 26000 social responsibility practices for improving sustainability performance in the freight transport industry.

Title: Investigating social sustainability practices in global supply networks: A fuzzy-set qualitative comparative analysis
Authors: Mohammad Najjar, Mahmoud M. Yasin, Marta Zorzini Bell, David Bell
Abstract summary: The paper investigates the adoption and influence of social sustainability practices on firm and supplier performance in global supply networks.

Title: Corporate social responsibility report readability, credit ratings and cost of borrowing
Authors: Kun Yu, Priya S. Garg
Abstract summary: More readable CSR reports are associated with higher credit ratings and lower borrowing costs, suggesting their importance in reducing information risk in credit markets.

Title: Managing Trade‐Offs Between Environmental, Social, Governance and Financial Sustainability in State‐Owned Enterprises: Insights from an Emerging Market
Authors: A. Adebayo, B. Ackers
Abstract summary: This paper is not directly relevant to the query about social sustainability reporting readiness in software services, as it focuses on how state-owned enterprises in South Africa balance environmental, social, governance and financial sustainability.

Title: Exploring Multi-level Drivers of Accountants’ Opinions on the Changes Introduced by the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive
Authors: Joanna Krasodomska, E. Zarzycka, Paweł Zieniuk
Abstract summary: Drivers at transnational, organizational, and individual levels positively influence accountants' support for expanded and mandatory sustainability reporting.

Title: Stock market reaction to mandatory sustainability reporting: Does carbon‐intensity and environmental, social, and governance reputation matter?
Authors: Dharen Kumar Pandey, Waleed M. Al‐ahdal, H. Hashim
Abstract summary: The paper examines the stock market reaction to mandatory sustainability reporting, finding that carbon-intensive firms are positively impacted while high ESG performance is negatively associated with the event-induced returns.

Title: Influence of stakeholders on supply chain social sustainability: New insights from small suppliers in the Indian manufacturing sector
Authors: Neha Uttam, Pankaj Dutta, Ashish Singh
Abstract summary: This paper is not directly relevant to the query about social sustainability reporting readiness in software services. It examines the influence of stakeholders on supply chain social sustainability adoption by small suppliers in the Indian manufacturing sector.

Title: Sustainability innovation index for micro, small and medium enterprises and their support ecosystems based on an empirical study in India
Authors: Sangeeta Agasty, Fawzia Tarannum, S. Narula
Abstract summary: This paper is not directly relevant to the query about social sustainability reporting readiness in software services. It focuses on developing a sustainability innovation index for micro, small and medium enterprises in India.

Title: Social procurement practices in food logistics: A case study of a South European food processing company
Authors: F. Pilati, Francesca Di Stradis
Abstract summary: This paper is not relevant to the query about social sustainability reporting readiness in software services.

Title: Social Capital and Supplier Adaptation of Social and Environmentally Sustainable Practices
Authors: L. Wamalwa, Patricia Meyer Nang'ole, Fanny Saruchera
Abstract summary: Buyer-supplier social capital enhances adoption of social and environmentally sustainable practices by suppliers in developing economies.

Title: The interplay of cash flow uncertainty and firm life cycle on sustainability disclosure
Authors: K. Shiljas, Dilip Kumar
Abstract summary: Cash flow uncertainty and firm life cycle negatively impact a firm's commitment to disclose sustainability information.

Title: Developing and testing a Tool for Rapid Assessment of Sustainability in Organisations
Authors: Rodrigo Lozano, María Barreiro-Gen
Abstract summary: The paper develops and tests a rapid sustainability assessment framework to help organizations address sustainability challenges and drivers.

Title: Investor response to corporate social responsibility performance: The role of corporate social responsibility reports readability
Authors: Zhaoxuan Sun, Shu‐Ning Wang, Dongdong Li
Abstract summary: This paper is not directly relevant to the query about social sustainability reporting readiness in software services and its challenges and drivers.
